content: high street mitts an easy fingerless mitt pattern by kelly meneely & lift bridge yarns ______________________________________________________ pattern info these mitts don t use very much yarn and work up so quickly they are the ideal instant gratification knit and a perfect use for that one special skein of chunky yarn knitting begins in the round at the cuff in 2x2 ribbing and using smaller needles once the cuff is completed you will change to your larger needles and change to stockinette stitch st st the thumb is formed using increases to form a gusset thumb stitches will then be put on hold to work in the round at the end the hand is rejoined and worked in st st and finished with 1x1 ribbing spice up your design with stripes or keep them all one color adjust needle size as necessary for gauge desired i ve also made the pattern printer-friendly if you select just the pages that contain pattern instructions materials yarn ● plymouth yarn chunky merino superwash 1 skein 100g 123yds neptune colorway ● one pair uses approximately 60g/75yds of chunky weight yarn amount varies with added length needles ● a set of 4 dpns double pointed needles in us 9 & 10 or 32 or longer circular needles in us 9 & 10 for the magic loop method © 2021 high street mitts lift bridge yarns 1 notions ● darning needle ● scissors ● stitch markers ● scrap yarn for thumb sts gauge 7 sts & 10 row/2 in st st on larger needles after blocking sizing one size finished palm measures 3 5 across the palm and 8 75 tall with the longer cuff option abbreviations k - knit m1r - make 1 right right leaning p - purl increase with the right needle lift the co - cast on bar between the previous and next bobble - bind off stitch and insert the left needle eor - end of round from behind using the right bor -
